intro: Mariscus sumatrensis var. evolutior, commonly known as the Sumatran mariscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting bodies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, this species is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
